content.description: One move wonder, giants need not apply.  Sitting on sloping boulder that holds up the right side of the "trailer", secure crimps and (ok, below) chest level and make awkward pull to better crimps.  Top out straight up.
content.protection: Recommend thinnest pad you have to make first move possible

content.description: Start as for truck driver right start, with right hand on a good sidepull crimp and left hand on the boulder's underside, figure out the jujitsu needed to pull off the ground, then move to the start of the V5 and finish up that.

Squat start with right hand on sharp vertical hold a few feet right of the obvious Truckdriver ledge, left hand on whatever you can find under the roof. Make desperate move for the ledge and then move up and right through crimp rail and individual crimps before the lip.
content.location: Truckdriver boulder just off purple trail, downhill from Moby Dick

content.description: Start two hands and a heel on the large sloping ledge in the center of the face.  Make a big move out left and follow crimps to another big move.  Stick the jug and top out.
content.location: Directly behind the Moby Dick boulder is a large boulder with a gap underneath of it.  Problems are on the north face of this boulder.

content.description: Start standing on good hands on each arete.  Slap your way up both aretes to the top.
content.location: This climbs the obvious overhanging boulder off the purple trail.  There is a small dropoff on the right side of the boulder, make sure you have pads and a spotter!

content.description: Sit start low on opposing pinches on left arete. Make core intensive moves to gain small right hand, set up on left arete, and make powerful move to gain face hold. From here link into stand start. Top out straight up for the full experience.
content.location: Obvious boulder off the purple trail, just shy of where it joins white.

content.description: The Moby Dick boulder sits directly on the trail, just north of the King & Queen seat. Trailer boulder sits directly behind Moby Dick.  A full bouldering guide can be found at mdguides.files.wordpress.co… courtesy of the folks at Crank Climbing
